</head>
    <body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><br><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">AMENDED AND RESTATED SENIOR
EXECUTIVE AGREEMENT</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">THIS
AMENDED AND RESTATED AGREEMENT by and between ON ASSIGNMENT, INC., a Delaware
corporation (the<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">
&#8220;Company&#8221;</font>) and PETER T. DAMERIS (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Executive&#8221;</font>) is entered into
on December 11, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Recitals</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
The Company and Executive previously entered into an agreement, dated October
27, 2003, pursuant to which Executive is employed as the Chief Executive Officer
and President of the Company, as amended on December 14, 2006 (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Prior Agreemen</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">t</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">B.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
The Company and Executive wish to amend and restate the Prior Agreement to
implement changes required under Internal Revenue Code (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Code</font>&#8221;)<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Section 409A (together
with the regulations and official interpretations thereof, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Section 409A</font>&#8221;)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">C.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Certain
definitions are set forth in&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Section 4</font> of this
Agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Agreement</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
parties hereto agree as follows:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Employment</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">.</font> &#160;The Company hereby
engages Executive to serve as the Chief Executive Officer and President of the
Company, and Executive agrees to serve the Company, during the Service Term (as
defined in <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Section
1(f)</font> hereof) in the capacities, and subject to the terms and conditions,
set forth in this Agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 126pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Services</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">.</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font>During the
Service Term, Executive, as Chief Executive Officer and President of the
Company, shall have all the duties and responsibilities customarily rendered by
Chief Executive Officers and Presidents of companies of similar size and nature
and as may be reasonably assigned from time to time by the Board (as defined
below).&#160;&#160;Executive will report directly to the
Board.&#160;&#160;Executive will devote his best efforts and substantially all
of his business time and attention (except for vacation periods and periods of
illness or other incapacity) to the business of the Company and its
Affiliates.&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding the foregoing, and provided that such
activities do not interfere with the fulfillment of Executive&#8217;s obligations
hereunder, Executive may (A)&#160;serve as an officer, director or trustee of
any charitable or non-profit entity; (B) own a passive investment in any private
company and own up to 5% of the outstanding voting securities of any public
company; or (C) with the prior approval of the Board, serve as a director of up
to two other companies so long as such companies do not compete with the Company
and Executive notifies the Board in advance of accepting any such
position.&#160;&#160;Unless the Company and Executive agree to the contrary,
Executive&#8217;s place of employment shall be at the Company&#8217;s principal executive
offices in Calabasas, California; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>,<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"> however</font>, that Executive
shall be permitted under the terms of this Agreement, upon conditions approved
by the Board, to relocate his principal residence to Texas and to perform his
duties and responsibilities under this Agreement from such <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">location and commute from
time to time to the Company&#8217;s principal executive offices so long as such
relocation does</font> not materially interfere with Executive&#8217;s satisfactory
performance of his duties and responsibilities under this Agreement and, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">further</font>, that Executive will
travel to such other locations as may be reasonably necessary in order to
discharge his duties and responsibilities hereunder.&#160;&#160;Executive shall
have the right to attend all meetings of the Board of Directors of the Company
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">and will be
nominated for election as a director for each term for which he is eligible to
serve during the Service Term</font>.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 126pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Salary, Bonus and
Benefits</font>.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 162pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Salary
and Bonus</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">.</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font>During the
Service Term, effective from and after August 1, 2006, the Company will pay
Executive a base salary (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Annual Base Salary</font>&#8221;) as the
Board may designate from time to time, at the rate of not less than $635,250 per
annum; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided,
however,</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font>that the
Annual Base Salary shall be subject to review annually (beginning in the third
quarter of each fiscal</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">year of the Company) by
the Board for upward increases thereon.&#160;&#160;</font>With respect to
calendar year 2006 and thereafter during the Service Period, Executive will be
eligible to receive an annual bonus in an amount of up to 120% of Executive&#8217;s
Annual Base Salary for each fiscal year, as determined by the Compensation
Committee of the Board of Directors (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Compensation Committee</font>&#8221;) based
upon the Company&#8217;s achievement of budgetary and other objectives set by the
Compensation Committee after review of a financial performance plan that is
prepared by Executive and recommended to the Compensation
Committee.&#160;&#160;Such annual bonus opportunity shall be comprised of (A) a
60% bonus opportunity applicable to achievement of plan targets that are a
combination of targets for revenue and EBITDA (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Component A</font>&#8221;), and (B) an
additional 60% bonus opportunity (thereby making the total bonus opportunity
120% of Executive&#8217;s Annual Base Salary) for performance exceeding plan targets
based upon revenue and EBITDA performance (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Component B</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The
performance targets for Component A and Component B may be revised in future
years by the Compensation Committee after consultation with
Executive.&#160;&#160;Within 90 days of the beginning of each calendar year
during the Service Period, the Compensation Committee will determine, after
consultation with Executive, the targets applicable to Executive based on the
Company&#8217;s performance plan.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;All
performance plan targets will be defined in terms that exclude the effects of
any nonrecurring charges, including without limitation, charges related to
goodwill write-offs, acquisitions, dispositions or changes in accounting
treatment.&#160;&#160;The annual bonus, if any, shall be due and payable to
Executive, in cash, on or prior to March 15</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">th</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> of the year immediately
following that in which such annual bonus is earned (for the avoidance of doubt,
this deadline is intended to comply with the &#8220;short-term deferral&#8221; exemption
from the application of Section 409A).</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 81pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 162pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Benefits</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">.</font>&#160; During the Service
Term, Executive shall be entitled to participate in and shall receive all
benefits under pension benefit plans provided by the Company (including without
limitation participation in any Company incentive, savings and retirement plans,
practices, policies and programs) to the extent applicable generally to other
peer executives of the Company.&#160; In addition, during the Service Term,
Executive and/or Executive&#8217;s family shall be entitled to participate and shall
receive all benefits under welfare plans provided by the Company (including
without limitation medical prescriptions, dental, disability, employee life,
group life, accidental life and travel accident insurance plans and plans) to
the extent and on the same basis applicable generally to other peer executives
of the Company.&#160; Executive shall be reimbursed for customary travel and
other expenses, subject to standard and reasonable documentation
requirements.&#160; In addition, Executive will receive a stipend of $450 per
month for lease of an automobile and other related expenses during the Service
Term, payable in equal monthly increments during the Service Term.&#160;
Executive shall also be eligible to receive four weeks paid vacation per
annum.&#160; Any unused vacation time during each fiscal year shall be
&#8220;rolled-over&#8221; to the following fiscal year to the extent permitted by the
Company&#8217;s policies for other senior executives of the Company.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 81pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 81pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;INTENTIONALLY
OMITTED</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 81pt; TEXT-INDENT: 81pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 198pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(iv)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">INTENTIONALLY
      OMITTED</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 126pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(v)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Additional Equity
Grants</font>.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(A)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Stock Option
Grants</font>.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Initial
Grant</font>.&#160;&#160;Promptly following the date of the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">first amendment to this
Agreement on December 14, 2006</font> (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Amendment Date</font>&#8221;), the Company
granted to Executive, under the Company&#8217;s Restated 1987 Stock Option Plan (As
Amended and Restated April 7, 2006) (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Equity Plan</font>), a
nonqualified&#160;&#160;stock option (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stock Option</font>&#8221;) to purchase
500,000<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0EQDAE">1</a></font> shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock (the
&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Initial</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stock Option</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The
Initial Stock Option was granted to Executive at an exercise price per share
equal to the closing price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the Nasdaq Stock
Market on the date of grant (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fair Market Value</font>&#8221;) and vests
and becomes exercisable, subject to Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the
Company through each such vesting</font></div>
    <div><br>
      <hr>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0EQDAE">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">1</font> This
number and the number in the following paragraph were calculated based on an
assumed pre-tax gain of $1.5 million after three years of 6% common stock price
appreciation.</font></div>
    </div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">date, as
follows: 11% on December 31, 2006, 1.83% on the last day of each month in 2007
(such that 33% has vested as of December 31, 2007), 2.83% on the last day of
each month in 2008 (such that 67% would be vested as of December 31, 2008),
1.83% on the last day of each month in 2009 (such that 89% would be vested as of
December 31, 2009) and 0.92% on the last day of each month in 2010 (such that
100% would be vested as of December 31, 2010).&#160;&#160;The terms and
conditions of the Initial Stock Option, including the applicable vesting
conditions, have been set forth in a stock option agreement entered into by the
Company and Executive which evidences the grant of the Initial Stock Option and,
except as otherwise expressly provided herein, is consistent with the terms and
conditions contained in stock option agreements provided to other key executives
of the Company (any agreement evidencing a Stock Option grant, a &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stock Option
Agreement</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Initial Stock Option is, subject to the
provisions of this Section 1(b)(v)(A)(1), Sections 1(b)(v)(F) and (G) and
1(c)(iii)(A) below, governed in all respects by the terms of the Equity Plan and
the applicable Stock Option Agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Subsequent
Grant</font>.&#160;&#160;On January 2, 2007, the Company granted to Executive,
under the Equity Plan, a nonqualified Stock Option to purchase 188,000 shares of
the Company&#8217;s common stock (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stock Option</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The
Subsequent Stock Option was granted to Executive at an exercise price per share
equal to the Fair Market Value and vests and becomes exercisable, subject to
Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the Company through each such vesting
date, as follows: 11% immediately and 1.83% on the last day of each month in
2007 (such that 33% vested as of December 31, 2007), 2.83% on the last day of
each month in 2008 (such that 67% would be vested as of December 31, 2008),
1.83% on the last day of each month in 2009 (such that 89% would be vested as of
December 31, 2009) and 0.92% on the last day of each month in 2010 (such that
100% would be vested as of December 31, 2010).&#160;&#160;The terms and
conditions of the Subsequent Stock Option, including the applicable vesting
conditions, have been set forth in a stock option agreement entered into by the
Company and Executive which evidences the grant of the Subsequent Stock Option
and, except as otherwise expressly provided herein, is consistent with the terms
and conditions contained in Stock Option Agreements provided to other key
executives of the Company.&#160;&#160;The Subsequent Stock Option is, subject to
the provisions of this Section 1(b)(v)(A)(2), Sections 1(b)(v)(F) and (G) and
1(c)(iii)(A) below, governed in all respects by the terms of the Equity Plan and
the applicable Stock Option Agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(B)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Time-Vesting Restricted
Stock Unit Grants</font>.&#160;&#160;The grant, vesting and payment of the
restricted stock unit grants described in this Section 1(b)(v)(B) are each
subject to the provisions of Sections 1(b)(v)(F), (G), (I) and (J), Section
1(c)(iii)(A) and Section 1(g) below, as applicable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Initial Grant</font>.&#160;&#160;On
January 2, 2007, the Company granted to Executive, under the Equity Plan, a
number of restricted stock units (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RSUs</font>&#8221;) covering shares of
Company common stock with a Fair Market Value of $500,000 (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Initial Time-Vesting RSU
Grant</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Initial<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Time-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>RSU Grant, except as
otherwise expressly provided herein, has been set forth in a restricted stock
unit agreement between Executive and the Company that is consistent with the
terms and conditions contained in restricted stock unit agreements provided to
other key executives of the Company (any agreement evidencing a grant of RSUs, a
&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RSU
Agreement</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Initial<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Time-Vesting RSU Grant
shall vest on the third anniversary of the Initial<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Time-Vesting RSU Grant
date, subject to Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the Company through such
vesting date and the other provisions of this Agreement.&#160;&#160;Shares of
Company common stock shall be delivered in respect of RSUs vesting in accordance
with this Section 1(b)(v)(B)(1) on or as soon as practicable after the third
anniversary of the grant date of such RSUs, but in no event more than fifteen
days after such third anniversary, with the exact payment date to be determined
by the Company in its sole discretion.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Subsequent
Grants</font>.&#160;&#160;On the first business day of each of 2008 and 2009,
subject, in the case of 2009, to Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the
Company through such date, the Company granted or shall grant to Executive, as
applicable, under the Equity Plan, RSUs covering shares of Company common stock
with a with a Fair Market Value of $500,000 (any such grant, a &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU
Grant</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Each Subsequent Time-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>RSU Grant is or shall
be, as applicable, set forth in a RSU Agreement and shall vest, subject to
Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the Company through each vesting date and
the other provisions of this</font></div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Agreement,
(i) with respect to the 2008 Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant, as to <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">23</font>/<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: sub">36</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">ths</font>&#160;&#160;of
the shares subject thereto on December 31, 2009 and as to&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">1</font>/<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: sub">36</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th </font>of the
shares subject thereto on each monthly anniversary of the grant date thereafter,
and (ii) with respect to the 2009 Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant, as to <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">11</font>/<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: sub">36</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">ths</font>&#160;&#160;of
the shares subject thereto on December 31, 2009 and as to <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">1</font>/<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: sub">36</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th </font>of the
shares subject thereto on each monthly anniversary of the grant date thereafter,
in each case, such that the Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant shall have vested
as to all shares subject thereto as of the third anniversary of the applicable
grant date.&#160;&#160;Shares of Company common stock shall be delivered in
respect of RSUs vesting in accordance with this Section 1(b)(v)(B)(2) on or as
soon as practicable after the third anniversary of the grant date of such RSUs,
but in no event more than fifteen days after such third anniversary, with the
exact payment date to be determined by the Company in its sole
discretion.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(C)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">TSR Performance-Vesting RSU
Grants</font>.&#160;&#160;The grant, vesting and payment of the restricted stock
unit grants described in this Section 1(b)(v)(C) are each subject to the
provisions of Sections 1(b)(v)(F), (G), (I) and (J), Section 1(c)(iii)(A) and
Section 1(g) below, as applicable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Initial Grant</font>.&#160;&#160;On
January 2, 2007, the Company granted to Executive, under the Equity Plan, RSUs
covering shares of Company common stock with a Fair Market Value of $500,000
(the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Initial TSR
Performance-Vesting RSU Grant</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Initial TSR
Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>RSU Grant is set forth
in a RSU Agreement.&#160;&#160;Subject to Executive&#8217;s continued employment with
the Company through the end of the third calendar year following the date of
grant (December 31, 2009) and the other provisions of this Agreement,&#160;on
the last day of the third calendar year following the date of grant (December
31, 2009), a 0-100% percentage of the Initial TSR Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>RSU Grant shall vest
based on the Company&#8217;s total share return performance compared to that of
certain peer companies for the three years following the date of the grant
(2007, 2008 and 2009), as specified below (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Initial TSR Performance
Goals</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Shares of Company common stock shall be delivered in
respect of RSUs vesting in accordance with this Section 1(b)(v)(C)(1) on
December 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Subsequent
Grants</font>.&#160;&#160;On the first business day of each of 2008 and 2009,
subject, in the case of 2009, to Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the
Company through such date, the Company granted or shall grant to Executive, as
applicable, under the Equity Plan, RSUs covering shares of Company common stock
with a Fair Market Value of $500,000 (any such grant, a &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting
RSU Grant</font>&#8221;).&#160; Each Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>RSU Grant is or shall
be, as applicable, set forth in a RSU Agreement.&#160;&#160;Subject to
Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the Company through the end of the third
calendar year following the date of grant (inclusive of the year in which the
grant is made) and the other provisions of this Agreement, on the last day of
such third calendar year following the date of grant, a 0-100% percentage of the
Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>RSU Grant&#160;shall
vest based on the Company&#8217;s total share return performance compared to that of
certain peer companies for such three-year period, as specified below (such
performance goals determined with respect to any Subsequent TSR
Performance-Vesting RSU Grant, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent TSR Performance
Goals</font>&#8221; and, together with the Initial TSR Performance Goals, the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">TSR Performance
Goals</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Shares of Company common stock shall be delivered in
respect of RSUs vesting in accordance with this Section 1(b)(v)(C)(2) on
December 31, 2010 in respect of the 2008 grant and December 31, 2011 in respect
of the 2009 grant.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TSR Performance
Goals</font>.&#160;&#160;The TSR Performance Goals shall be based on the
appreciation in the price of the Company&#8217;s common stock and dividends (assuming
reinvestment in the stock) compared to certain peer companies agreed to by the
Executive and the Company within the first 90 days of the first year of the
grant and set forth in the minutes of the Compensation Committee.&#160;&#160;The
price appreciation will be measured as the difference between the average
closing prices of the common stock of the Company and the peer companies on the
first 20 trading days of the first calendar year and the last 20 trading days of
the third calendar year.&#160;&#160;For purposes of the calculation, the
Company&#8217;s common stock price at the beginning of the first year shall be
adjusted such that it would equal the price/EBITDA multiple for the peer
companies.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0EZVAE">2</a></font>&#160;&#160;The mean (50<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile) percentage</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">return of
the peer companies will be calculated as the arithmetic average of the
percentages of each.&#160;&#160;The highest return of the peer companies will be
the 100<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile and the lowest return of the peer companies shall be the 0<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0EHXAE">3</a></font>&#160;&#160;On such basis compared to the
selected companies, (1) for less than the 42.5<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile the vesting percentage shall be 0%, (2) for between the 42.5<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile and the mean (50<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile) the vesting percentage shall be between 25% and 50% (based on a
sliding scale), (3) for between the mean (50<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile) and the 70<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile the vesting percentage shall be between 50% and 83.5% (based on a
sliding scale), (4) for between the 70<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile and the 80<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile the vesting percentage shall be between 83.5% and 100% (based on a
sliding scale) and (5) for above the 80<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile the vesting percentage shall be 100%.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0EZZAE">4</a></font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(D)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">EBITDA Performance-Vesting
Restricted Stock Grants</font>. The grant and vesting of the restricted stock
described in this Section 1(b)(v)(D) are each subject to the provisions of
Sections 1(b)(v)(F), (G), (I) and (J) below, as applicable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Initial Grant</font>.&#160;&#160;On
January 2, 2007, the Company granted to Executive, under the Equity Plan, a
number of restricted shares of Company common stock (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Restricted Stock</font>&#8221;) with a Fair
Market Value of $500,000 (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting
Restricted Stock Grant</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Initial EBITDA
Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Restricted Stock Grant
is subject to restrictions (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Restrictions</font>&#8221;)&#160;set forth
in an&#160;agreement between Executive and the Company consistent with the terms
and conditions contained in restricted stock agreements provided to other key
executives of the Company (any agreement evidencing a grant of Restricted Stock,
a &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Restricted Stock
Agreement</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;At the end of the third calendar year following
the date of grant (December 31, 2009), a 0-100% percentage of the shares subject
to the Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Restricted Stock
Grant&#160;specified (or certified) by the Compensation Committee shall vest and
all Restrictions thereon shall lapse, if (and only if) (1) the Company has
attained (with a target of 50%) the annual EBITDA growth goals for the first
year following the date of the grant (2007) (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Initial EBITDA Performance
Goals</font>&#8221;) and (2) Executive remains continuously employed with the Company
through the end of the third calendar year following the date of grant (December
31, 2009).</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Subsequent
Grants</font>.&#160;&#160;On the first business day of 2008 and 2009, subject in
the case of 2009 to Executive&#8217;s continued employment with the Company through
such date, the Company granted or shall grant to Executive, as applicable, under
the Equity Plan, a number of shares of Restricted Stock with a Fair Market Value
of $500,000 (any such grant, a &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent EBITDA Performance-Vesting
Restricted Stock Grant</font>&#8221;).&#160; Each Subsequent EBITDA
Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Restricted Stock Grant
is or shall be, as applicable, set forth in a Restricted Stock
Agreement.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2009, a 0-100% percentage of the shares
subject to the Subsequent EBITDA Performance-Vesting<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Restricted Stock
Grant&#160;specified (or certified) by the Compensation Committee shall vest and
all Restrictions thereon shall lapse, if (and only if) (1) the Company has
attained (with a target of 50%) the annual EBITDA growth goals for the first
year following the date of the grant (such EBITDA growth goals determined with
respect to any Subsequent EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant,
&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent EBITDA Performance
Goals</font>&#8221; and, together with the Initial EBITDA Performance Goals, the
&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EBITDA Performance
Goals</font>&#8221; and, together with the TSR Performance Goals, the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Performance Goals</font>&#8221;) and (2)
Executive remains continuously employed with the</font></div>
    <div><br>
      <hr>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0EZVAE">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">2</font> For
example, if the Company&#8217;s closing stock price at the beginning of the first year
reflects a multiple of the EBITDA for the twelve months ended September 30, 2006
of 12 and the mean closing stock price of the peer companies reflects a multiple
of 10, the Company&#8217;s stock price at the beginning of the first year for purposes
of the calculation would be reduced by 16.67%.</font></div>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0EHXAE">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">3</font> For
example, if the total shareholder return for peer companies is 3%, 5% and 7%,
(1) the 0<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile shall be 3%, (2) the 35<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile shall be 4.4%, (3) the 42.5<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile shall be 4.7%, (4) the mean (50<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile) shall be 5% (5) the 70<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile shall be 5.8%, (6) the 80<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile shall be 6.2%, and (7) the 100<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
percentile shall be 7%.</font></div>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0EZZAE">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">4</font> For
example, if the median total shareholder return for the peer companies for 2007,
2008 and 2009 is 5% and the difference between the adjusted stock price of the
Company&#8217;s common stock at the beginning of 2007 and the actual stock price of
the Company&#8217;s common stock at the end of 2009 is 5%, 50% of the shares subject
to the Initial TSR Performance-Vesting RSU Grant shall vest on December 31, 2009
subject to the other provisions of this Agreement.</font></div>
    </div><br>

    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Company
through December 31, 2009. </font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">EBITDA Performance
Goals</font>.&#160;&#160;The EBITDA Performance Goals shall be adopted by the
Compensation Committee in consultation with Executive no later than 90 days
after the applicable grant date and shall be set such that that there is a
reasonable likelihood of attainment of the target, which would result in 50%
vesting of the Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant or
Subsequent EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant, as
applicable.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(E)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Stock
Bonus</font>.&#160;&#160;Promptly following the Amendment Date, the Company made
a one-time grant to Executive, under the Equity Plan, of 25,000 fully vested and
unrestricted shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Stock Bonus</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(F)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Certain
Events</font>.&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding the foregoing and the Executive Change
of Control Agreement between the Company and Executive, dated December 11, 2008
(the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Executive Change of
Control Agreement</font>&#8221;), immediately prior to the earliest to occur of a
Corporate Transaction (as defined in the Equity Plan) (and notwithstanding
Section 18.3 of that Equity Plan), or a Change of Control (as defined in the
Executive Change of Control Agreement) (together, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Corporate Events</font>&#8221;) occurring
during the Service Period, subject to Section 1(b)(iii)(I) and (J) and Section
1(g) hereof, as applicable:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 216pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any
unvested Initial Stock Option and Subsequent Stock Option shall vest fully as
set forth in the Executive Change of Control Agreement;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 216pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any
Initial Time-Vesting RSU Grant and Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant shall vest
fully as set forth in the Executive Change of Control
Agreement.&#160;&#160;Shares in respect of such vested RSUs shall be delivered,
(a) if such Corporate Event constitutes a &#8220;change in control event&#8221; within the
meaning of Section 409A, on or as soon as practicable after the date on of such
Corporate Event, but in no event more than fifteen days after such Corporate
Event, with the exact payment date to be determined by the Company in its sole
discretion, or (b) if such Corporate Event does not constitute a &#8220;change in
control event&#8221; within the meaning of Section 409A, then within fifteen days
after (with the exact payment date to be determined by the Company in its sole
discretion) the earliest to occur of Executive&#8217;s &#8220;separation from service&#8221;
(within the meaning of Section 409A(a)(2)(A)(i) of the Code, and Treasury
Regulation Section 1.409A-1(h)) (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Separation from Service</font>&#8221;),
death or Disability, the occurrence of a &#8220;change in control event&#8221; with respect
to Executive within the meaning of Section 409A or the third anniversary of the
applicable grant date;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 216pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any
unvested Initial TSR Performance-Vesting RSU Grant and Subsequent TSR
Performance-Vesting RSU Grant shall vest in accordance with the attainment of
the Performance Goals through the date of the Corporate Event (and not pro-rated
for any time elapsed during the period).<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0EMIAG">5</a></font>&#160;&#160;Shares in respect of such vested
RSUs shall be delivered (a) if such Corporate Event constitutes a &#8220;change in
control event&#8221; within the meaning of Section 409A, on or as soon as practicable
after the date of such Corporate Event, but in no event more than fifteen days
after such Corporate Event, with the exact payment date to be determined by the
Company in its sole discretion, or (b) if such Corporate Event does not
constitute a &#8220;change in control event&#8221; within the meaning of Section 409A, then
within fifteen days after (with the exact payment date to be determined by the
Company in its sole discretion) the earliest to occur of Executive&#8217;s Separation
from Service, death or Disability, the occurrence of a &#8220;change in control event&#8221;
with respect to Executive within the meaning of Section 409A or the third
anniversary of the applicable grant date; and</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 216pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(4)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any
unvested Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant and
Subsequent EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant</font></div>
    <div><br>
      <hr>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0EMIAG">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">5</font> For
example, if such event occurs on June 30, 2008 and the TSR Performance Goals had
been met at the maximum levels through such date, 100% of the Initial TSR
Performance-Vesting RSU Grant and the Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting RSU
Grant made in 2008 shall vest.</font></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">shall
vest (a) for years that have been completed, in accordance with the attainment
of the Performance Goals for such year, and (b) for the year in which such event
occurs, in accordance with the greater of the attainment of the Performance
Goals for the prior year and the attainment of the Performance Goals to date in
such year (and not pro-rated for any time elapsed during the year).<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0ESKAG">6</a></font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(G)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Forfeiture</font>.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">General</font>.&#160;&#160;Except as
otherwise provided in this Agreement, all shares subject to the Initial Stock
Option, the Subsequent Stock Option, the Initial Time-Vesting RSU Grant, any
Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant, the Initial TSR Performance-Vesting RSU
Grant, any Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting RSU Grant, the Initial EBITDA
Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant and any Subsequent EBITDA
Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant (together, the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">2006 Equity Awards</font>&#8221;) that have
not vested and, in the case of any options, become exercisable, or with respect
to which the Restrictions have not lapsed (after taking into consideration any
vesting, exercisability and/or Restriction lapsing that may occur prior to or in
connection with any termination of employment, as provided in this Agreement or
any other agreement with Executive), as applicable, as of the earlier to occur
of Executive&#8217;s termination of employment for any reason, a Corporate Event, the
third anniversary of the applicable grant date or, in the case of Subsequent
EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grants only, December 31, 2009
(after taking into consideration any vesting and lapsing of Restrictions that
may occur in connection with any termination or Corporate Event), shall be
forfeited and canceled upon the earliest such event to occur , without
consideration therefor.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Time-Vesting
RSUs</font>.&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding Section 1(b)(v)(B) above, on or prior to
December 31, 2009, in the event of Executive&#8217;s death, Disability or termination
by the Company without Cause, and after December 31, 2009, in the event
of&#160;&#160;termination of Executive&#8217;s employment for any reason, including
voluntarily by Executive, any unvested Initial Time-Vesting RSU Grant and
Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant shall vest immediately prior to such events,
on a pro-rata basis (based on the number of months Executive worked since the
date of grant) with respect to the shares constituting such
grant.&#160;&#160;Shares of Company common stock shall be delivered in respect
of RSUs vesting in accordance with this Section 1(b)(v)(G)(2) on or as soon as
practicable after the date of Executive&#8217;s Separation from Service or, if
earlier, Executive&#8217;s death or Disability, but in no event more than fifteen days
after any such event, subject to Section 1(g) of this Agreement, with the exact
payment date to be determined by the Company in its sole
discretion.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Performance-Vesting
RSUs</font>.&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding Section 1(b)(v)(C) above, on or prior to
December 31, 2009, in the event of Executive&#8217;s death, Disability or termination
by the Company without Cause, and after December 31, 2009, in the event
of&#160;&#160;termination of Executive&#8217;s employment for any reason, including
voluntarily by Executive, any unvested Initial TSR Performance-Vesting RSU Grant
and Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting RSU Grant shall vest in accordance with
the attainment of the Performance Goals through the date of such event (and
shall be pro-rated for time elapsed during the period).<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0ESPAG">7</a></font> Shares in respect of RSUs that vest in
accordance with this Section 1(b)(v)(G)(3) shall be delivered, subject to
Section 1(g) of this Agreement, as soon as practicable after the earliest to
occur of Executive&#8217;s Separation from Service, death, Disability or the third
anniversary of the applicable grant date, but in no event more than fifteen days
after such event, with the exact payment date to be determined by the Company in
its sole discretion, and</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(4)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">EBITDA Performance-Vesting
Restricted Stock</font>.&#160;&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding Section 1(b)(v)(D)
above, on or prior to December 31, 2009, in the event of</font></div>
    <div><br>
      <hr>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0ESKAG">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">6</font> For
example, if such event occurs on June 30, 2008 and the EBITDA Performance Goals
had been met at the maximum levels for 2007 and the first half of 2008, 100% of
the Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant and the Subsequent
EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant made in 2008 shall
vest.</font></div>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0ESPAG">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">7</font> For
example, if such event occurs on June 30, 2008 and the TSR Performance Goals had
been met at the maximum levels through such date, 50% of the Initial TSR
Performance-Vesting RSU Grant and 16.67% of the Subsequent TSR
Performance-Vesting RSU Grant made in 2008 shall vest.</font></div>
    </div><br>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
      </div>
    </div><br>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Executive&#8217;s
death, Disability or termination by the Company without Cause, any unvested
Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant and Subsequent EBITDA
Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant shall vest (I) for years that have
been completed, in accordance with the attainment of the Performance Goals for
such year, and (II) for the year in which such event occurs, in accordance with
the attainment of the Performance Goals to date in such year (and pro-rated for
time elapsed during the year).<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super"><a href="#ref.ID0E3RAG">8</a></font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt"></font>(5)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Cause</font>.&#160;&#160;If the
Company terminates Executive&#8217;s employment for Cause, any outstanding 2006 Equity
Awards (other than vested shares of Restricted Stock) shall be forfeited, as of
the commencement of business on the date of such termination, with respect to
all then-unpaid shares subject thereto, whether or not vested at the time of
termination, without consideration therefor.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(H)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;INTENTIONALLY
OMITTED</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 198pt"></font>(I)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Internal Revenue Code
Section 162(m)</font>.&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding anything contained herein to
the contrary, if the Compensation Committee determines in its reasonable
discretion that the Company&#8217;s tax deduction that would otherwise arise under
Section 162 of the Code in connection with the vesting and delivery of any
shares of Company common stock in respect of the Initial Time-Vesting RSU Grant,
any Subsequent Time-Vesting RSU Grant, the Initial TSR Performance-Vesting RSU
Grant and/or any Subsequent TSR Performance-Vesting RSU Grant, in any case,
would be materially limited or reduced by the application of Section 162(m) of
the Code, then, to the extent necessary to prevent such limitation or reduction,
the Company may delay the delivery of such shares until the earliest practicable
date in the earlier to occur of (a) the first year in which the Company
reasonably anticipates that the delivery of such shares will not result in such
limitation or reduction, or (b) the year in which Executive&#8217;s employment with
the Company terminates, subject to Section 1 (g) of this
Agreement.&#160;&#160;For the avoidance of doubt, the provisions contained in
this Section 1(b)(v)(I) are intended to comply with the permissible delay of
certain payments described in Treas. Reg. Section
1.409A-2(b)(7)(i).</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 108pt"></font>(J)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Employment
Taxes</font>.&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the
contrary, to the extent that any compensation payable hereunder, including
without limitation, under any of the 2006 Equity Awards, constitutes
&#8220;nonqualified deferred compensation&#8221; within the meaning of Section 409A, the
payment of any such compensation may be accelerated to the greatest extent
permitted under Treasury Regulation 1.409A-3(j)(4)(vi) to pay any taxes imposed
under the Federal Insurance Contribution Act (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FICA</font>&#8221;) on such compensation or
under Code Section 3401 or corresponding withholding provisions of applicable
state, local or foreign tax laws as income tax obligations arising in connection
with any such acceleration, including any additional taxes attributable to
pyramiding wages and taxes, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>, that the total of
any such accelerated payment shall not exceed the applicable FICA and income tax
obligations to which such accelerated payments relate.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 126pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Termination</font>.</font></div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            </td>

              <div align="left">&#160;</div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 162pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(i)</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Events of
Termination</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">.</font>&#160; Executive&#8217;s employment
with the Company shall cease upon:</font></div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 79.2pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>

              <div align="left">&#160;</div>

    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(A)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Executive&#8217;s
      death.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(B)</font></div>
            </td>

              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Executive&#8217;s
      voluntary retirement.</font></div>
            </td>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 198pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(C)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Executive&#8217;s
&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Disability</font>&#8221; means
Executive has become disabled within the meaning of Section 409A.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div><br>
      <hr>
    </div>
    <div><a name="ref.ID0E3RAG">&#160; </a>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">8</font> For
example, if such event occurs on June 30, 2008 and the EBITDA Performance Goals
had been met at the maximum levels for 2007 and the first half of 2008, 100% of
the Initial EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant and 50% of the
Subsequent EBITDA Performance-Vesting Restricted Stock Grant made in 2008 shall
vest.</font></div>

    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
